properties.description: Opened by Lord Rosebery, an ornate building with elegant decor influenced by the Art Nouveau movement. Several notable rooms including the Great Hall with unique stained glass, antique mirrors and Clerkenwell Angel statuettes.
properties.name: The Old Finsbury Town Hall

properties.description: Grade II-listed Georgian domestic building c.1760, formerly part of Bedford Estate. Interior refurbished 1924-5 to form lecture hall (restored 2014), library, bookshop and offices. Oak woodwork and green Doulton tiles line the staircase.
properties.name: The Swedenborg Society

properties.description: Houses the City of London's art collection, built over remains of London's Roman amphitheatre. Façade uses Portland stone and Collyweston stone slates. Interior uses finishes of marble, American elm, damask and painted wall coverings.
properties.name: Guildhall Art Gallery

properties.description: Part of an international family of Ismaili Centres, a religious, cultural and social space for the Shia Ismaili Muslim community. The serenity of the entrance fountain to the roof garden reflects Muslim traditions in architecture and design
properties.name: The Ismaili Centre

properties.description: A unique II* listed Italianate church by John Dando Sedding with attached Campanile and Institute Building. Of particular significance in the church is the imposing baldacchino over the High Altar, which dominates the east end.
properties.name: The Church of Our Most Holy Redeemer

properties.description: Grade I listed early medieval parish church (from 952 before Tower of London) in spacious churchyard. Fine interior: Anglo-Saxon Rood, Norman font, 'squint', fine memorials incl founders of Trinity House, 1950s glass. Bells of Stepney.
properties.name: St Dunstan and All Saints Church

properties.description: Learn about the built environment of the City of London. The interactive 1:500 scale Pipers model contains an overview of the City with the latest developments and architecture. See the future skyline with all of the proposed new towers.
properties.name: The City Centre

properties.description: This Grade II* listed building includes an Adam-style ceiling (first floor) and two beautiful staircases with wrought-iron balustrades. Once home to the Pharmaceutical Society of Great Britain, it now houses a historical research institute.
properties.name: German Historical Institute

properties.description: A modern 4-storey building incorporating the much-loved Victorian library. The galleries and feature walls display exhibitions and contemporary art and a dramatic central atrium provides natural ventilation and daylight throughout.
properties.name: The Library at Willesden Green

properties.description: Maggie's Barts opened in December 2017. Maggie's Centres are unique, welcoming and uplifting places with qualified staff on hand to provide free practical, emotional and social support for people with cancer, their families and friends.
properties.name: Maggie's Barts

properties.description: The building is a church worship area with an additional hall, meeting rooms, offices, a children's library and 33 affordable units of accommodation made up of one, two and three bedroom flats.
properties.name: Westbourne Park Baptist Church

properties.description: The project includes 24 high quality homes which respond to their surroundings in both scale and materiality, with high quality, light coloured brickwork to complement the local area.
properties.name: Windmill Place

properties.description: Formerly 269 Leigham Court Road, Kate Macintosh designed the Grade II Listed sheltered housing scheme of 44 flats,  common room, shop and amenities contained in seven blocks, linked by a covered walkway surrounded by trees and gardens.
properties.name: Macintosh Court Sheltered Housing Scheme

properties.description: A 5,700 sq m residential-led mixed-use development for Peabody in Plumstead, South London
properties.name: The Reach

properties.description: The museum is situated in a shopfront in Leegate Shopping Centre, which has been described by the Evening Standard as "the worst shopping precinct in the country."
properties.name: Museum of Neoliberalism

properties.description: Becontree Estate two storey cottage house with garden located on a banjo.
properties.name: Alderman Jones House

properties.description: Reliance Arcade is a Grade II Listed covered market in Brixton, London.  The Arcade was constructed in the 1920s and is home to 40 small retail units catering largely to local African-Caribbean communities.
properties.name: Reliance Arcade

properties.description: Online tour of some of London and its estuary's hidden infrastructure - the systems and facilities that power our city and keep us alive, but we rarely think about. How does it all connect with the ship that blocked the Suez Canal?
properties.name: Hidden London: Life Support

properties.description: This ambitious transformation of the former Camden Town Hall Annexe, a 1974 Brutalist structure, into a landmark hotel was achieved through the restoration of the original concrete façade and the addition of three striking storeys.
properties.name: The Standard, London

properties.description: A grand riverside Victorian pub, named after Horatio Nelson's victory at the Battle of Trafalgar. Featuring hundreds of original paintings on the walls.
properties.name: Trafalgar Tavern

properties.description: We Design Homes talks to Amos Goldreich about his latest projects, discussing the relationships they form with those they work with to create homes that have a positive impact on people’s lives and are a joy to experience.
properties.name: Creating thoughtful homes with Amos Goldreich Architecture

properties.description: We will explore sites and institutions with direct links to the history of slavery and hear why the apologies were made in 2020, whilst wandering within the story packed streets and alleyways of the Square Mile.
properties.name: Slavery and the City

properties.description: Completed in Summer 2021, the National Youth Theatre has been redeveloped to double its capacity for studio space and was designed with young people, for young people. Recipient of the Mayor of London's Good Growth Fund.
properties.name: National Youth Theatre

properties.description: The four-story Church façade and prominent seven-story tower is covered in Portland stone and highlighted by a golden steeple. The interior features the Christus statue and a large mural of the resurrected Jesus Christ.
properties.name: Hyde Park Chapel

properties.description: Wren designed building of 1675, interior lost in blitz of 1940, reopened 1957 with 'Wren inspired' interior
properties.name: St Bride's Church, Fleet Street

properties.description:
Ripple Greenway is a beautiful 14-acre linear park and art trail.  Home to Katy Hallett’s steel sculptures, inspired by Robert Macfarlane’s and Jackie Morris’ The Lost Words.
Wooden play and exercise equipment, picnic tables and benches.
properties.name: Ripple Greenway and the Lost Words Art Trail

properties.description: Join us for a behind the scenes visit to the new Green Logistics Centre housed in a recently refurbished arch in the heart of the Low Line in Bankside
properties.name: Low Line - Green Logistics Centre

properties.description: The Museum of Enfield is this year bringing its temporary exhibition to you! “From Enfield to Fork” explores the borough’s history and relationship with food, from Roman Enfield to Market Gardening.
properties.name: Enfield To Fork - Edmonton Green Shopping Centre

properties.description: South Quay Plaza is a landmark development and has been designed to maximise space in the 2.6 acres of gardens that surround it, allowing sunlight to flood the gardens and provide dual aspect views for many of the apartments.
properties.name: Hampton Tower at SQP

properties.description: The walk is around Old Malden and covers residential developments within the district. Different styles of suburban architecture includes a selection of modernist housing. There are also historic buildings and other places of interest.
properties.name: Self-guided Old Malden Walk

properties.description: Join Rowan, a retired solicitor, to find out what happens in the Royal Courts of Justice and the Inns of Court - a little world that few Londoners know
properties.name: Legal London

properties.description: Focussing on how the South Bank’s unique location and pattern of land ownership has shaped its history, the tour will address how businesses, communities, and locals have played a part in the area’s growth, management, and conservation
properties.name: ‘A tonic to the nation’: South Bank 1951-2021

properties.description: Tours with Bill Jennings, former Becontree Estate Housing Manager. Tours will highlight the heritage and history of the estate, including Valence House museum and library, Kingsley Hall and the unique architectural features of the estate
properties.name: Becontree Estate Walking Tours with Bill Jennings
